name: Magnolia Hotel And Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. It is a boutique hotel with excellent service. Good service seems to be lacking at so many hotels these days, but the staff at the Magnolia were exceptional. My room was excellent, with all sort of great extras (chocolates every day, bath bombe, aveda products, etc.). Also, unlike other hotels who nickel and dime you to death... internet was free. There is a decent breakfast included every morning, business centre, exercise room, etc. Also, the location is very central and within walking distance to all tourist and business destinations.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was excellent (Prime). I also had a Spa Magnolia Signature treatment at the Spa on site. Ruth was my spa therapist and I have to say it was the best treatment of that kind I have ever had, and I have had several.
reviews.title: Luxurious and Relaxing Staycation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is nothing bad to say about the Magnolia. Excellent value for money and really great service.
reviews.title: Loved everything about the Magnolia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a night away from the kids at the Magnolia hotel. It was a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location. We were overlooking the harbor on the top floor. The room was very elegant. We really enjoyed the bathrobes and fireplace. The bathroom had a soaker tub and separate shower. Everything was really clean. All the staff that we dealt with were so friendly and helpful. I will recommend the Magnolia to all my friends and family!
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stay at the Magnolia with my mom, aunt and daughter and we all loved this hotel. The front desk staff was efficient and polite. We booked two double rooms which were spacious, clean, and very reasonably priced at $105 each.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I arrived Victoria by sea plane. Harbour air provides a shuttle that takes you to to hotel from the terminal.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, convenient location, elegant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thums Up:
reviews.title: Excellent Staff & Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -great location: close to the harbour
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: -I got upgraded to a room with a view of the harbour and the palimount, georgous view
reviews.title: It was all in the little details that made my stay so enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -the room is clean and spacious
reviews.title: Wonderful hideaway in our own city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel with a fantastic location. Right downtown, shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Quick drive to Oak Bay, Beacon Hill Park, etc. We had a large cozy room with a fireplace and a great view of the Parliament Building. A lot of attention to details that large hotels omit (eg included breakfast, chocolates in the room, umbrella in the room, plush bath robes and slippers, bath bombs to use in the deep tub) Staff was excellent. Aveda spa is connected and was very good . We would return in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel, great location, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in numerous hotels in Canada and the US, and I have to say, the Magnolia is a beuatiful hotel. The service is amazing, the rooms are clean and bright, and the Spa is wonderful. We did not eat at the restaurant (except fot the breakfast) as we had made other arrangements with friends but the decor was very nice. We got chocolates in our room during turndown, and when we arrived! I loved the large bath tub in the room, and the fireplace was very cozy!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel... Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be back for sure and hopefully a little longer next time!
reviews.title: Rodent Infestation and Staff Didn't Care.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say, the hotel seemed pretty nice. Location is good; nice rooms; nice amenities; great Spa.... but there's a problem: THE HOTEL HAS MICE, apparently many mice too.
reviews.title: classy, small, friendly, great location boutique hotel/spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I booked 2 night stay in November, and we chose the Magnolia based on the good review we read. When we arrived in Victoria, the hotel was a little hard to find, but once we found it we were at first pleased with what we saw. The lobby is elegant and there's free coffee and tea. Check-in was pleasant, if slow (but it was busy). The young man at the counter were polite and efficient, and seemed genuinely interested in helping us find things to do the next day. And the valet service ($15) seemed a good deal. That was all nice... but that's where it ended!
reviews.title: Package pricing deceptive -- otherwise good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent downtown Location, Well maintained with spotless rooms, all in-suite amenities included. Close to the Harbour with an excellent view and walking distance to all the Victoria sights.
reviews.title: Urban Chic Downtown Victoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a celebration of our anniversary, we met another couple at the Magnolia for 2 days before an Alaskan Cruise and wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel is just around the corner from the famous Empress Hotel, and we think it's a MUCH better choice! Charming ambiance! The building is a beautifully maintained original architectural gem, the lobby full of huge beautiful arrangements of fresh flowers, comfy sofas and chairs, and a fireplace. The rooms were very open and spacious, with inviting beds dressed with down comforters. Aveda products were in the big, beautiful bathrooms with very nice marble counters and solid bath tubs (sounds odd, but I think a great room with a cheap bath is a let-down) There was a "greeting gift" of a small treasure chest with wonderful local chocolates. bottles of water, and passes to a museum. The staff was marvelous, offering suggestions for dining at "local's favorites" and everything was within an easy walk. There is also a restaurant/bar attached that is fantastic! We sat at the bar for a while late one afternoon and were treated like long lost friends. The breakfast buffet they offered was delicious, too. This was a "once in a lifetime" trip for me, and I cherish the memory, because every thing about it was perfect.
reviews.title: I've always wanted to see Victoria,; the romance, charm and beauty I'd dreamed of was all there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was a great hotel with friendly courteous staff, the room was impecable as was the valet service. I would have no problem using or recommending this hotel to any friend or family member.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, excellent price and quality room.
reviews.title: Great Choice!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Victoria.
reviews.title: What a really great place!!!

description: Downtown Victoria’s Favourite Boutique Hotel.Beautifully refreshed new guest rooms with plush textures, elegant patterns and raw-silk inspired walls. Outstanding location, just 2 blocks from Victoria’s picturesque Inner Harbour and in the heart of the city’s best shopping, dining and entertainment. Tranquil Spa Magnolia and the exciting new Catalano Restaurant & Cicchetti Bar. The kind of undistracted attention you can only receive in a boutique hotel with just 64 rooms.
